biography.bio: Louise Ullrich was born in Vienna, the daughter of a major in the Austro/Hungarian Army. She studied at the Kunstakademie, and, while still a teenager, was contracted for two years by the Wiener Volkstheater where she enjoyed her first success on the stage. In late 1932, Louise received an engagement from the Lessing Theater in Berlin to co-star opposite Werner Krauss in 'Rauhnacht'. During one of her performances she was spotted by actor and film-maker Luis Trenker who cast her in the leading role of Erika in Der Rebell (1932). While Louise was inevitably secondary to both star and scenery, the picture did provide a stepping stone to further opportunities. In the Max Ophüls-directed Liebelei (1933) she had second billing behind established star Magda Schneider (mother of Romy) and the following year appeared in the title role of Erich Waschneck's Régine (1935). Other prestigious films with budding star Louise were to come: Viktoria (1935), a romance based on a novel by Knut Hamsun; and Annelie (1941), a family movie which earned the film studio Ufa the then record sum of six and a half million Reichsmark and garnered Ullrich the Coppa Volpi award in Venice. Her films also established her as an actress of stature - not of the conventional leading lady variety, not particularly ornamental or even especially beautiful - but of the ideal 'girl next door' type: tomboyish, spirited, charming and witty. Alternatively -- as in 'Annelie' -- she would embody the archetypal mother figure (resonating significantly with wartime filmgoers) or a weak-willed , sad wife (as in the title role of Henrik Ibsen's Nora (1944)). Audiences and critics alike applauded her performances and Louis B. Mayer even offered her a contract at MGM in 1938 which Louise declined. Instead, she traveled to South America where she met her future husband, Count Wulf Dietrich zu Castell, director of Munich-Riem airport. After the war, Louise Ullrich made a seamless transition to character roles, dividing her time between stage and screen. One of her notable film appearances during this time was as Cornelie in Harald Braun's Keepers of the Night (1949). Though she had misgivings about the maudlin sentimentality and melodramatics of the screenplay (stating in her autobiography that it wouldn't have mattered to her whether she got the part or not!), the critic Gunter Groll praised her performance as more mature and defined while always retaining her distinguishing genuine qualities. In the 1960's, she made a number of television appearances (including a series by Rainer Werner Fassbinder, in which she played a strong-willed grandmother) and in 1973 published her memoirs. Louise Ullrich spent most of her remaining years writing and painting. One of her last works was an Australian travel memoir, published in 1985. The popular actress died of cancer in January that year.
biography.name: Luise Ullrich

biography.bio: Handsome matinée idol and star of post-war German film, Viennese-born Rudolf Prack was afforded the singular contractual distinction (though somewhat to his detriment) of being never permitted to act in a villainous part - lest his popularity with the female audience be diminished. The son of a postal worker who died in 1922, leaving massive debts in his wake, young Rudolf spent his teenage years as a bank clerk. Once his father's debts had at last been expunged, he began to study at the Max Reinhardt Seminar in Vienna and was eventually engaged by Hans Thimig to appear on stage at the Theater in der Josefstadt. His screen career took off rather slowly after his 1937 debut, but he registered early successes as a charismatic poacher in Krambambuli (1940) and as a farm boy seduced by Kristina Söderbaum in Veit Harlan's La ville dorée (1942). After the war, he came into his own as rather more sophisticated, urbane leads in sentimental , simplistic 'Heimatfilms', like The Black Forest Girl (1950), or _Grün ist die Heide (1951)_. Eschewing offers from Hollywood, he formed popular screen partnerships with leading ladies Sonja Ziemann and Marianne Koch, though both were decades younger. Prack won the first of two Bambi Awards in 1949, ahead of English star Stewart Granger, by a margin of seven percent of the votes. In the 1960's, he made a successful transition to character roles, notably as a country doctor in the bucolic television series Landarzt Dr. Brock (1967). Prack retired from acting in 1976 and died of pneumonia in Vienna in December 1981.
biography.name: Rudolf Prack

biography.bio: Albert Lieven was born on June 23, 1906 in Hohenstein, Germany as Albert Fritz Liévin-Liévin. He was an actor, known for The Guns of Navarone (1961), The Life and Death of Colonel Blimp (1943) and The Seventh Veil (1945). He was married to Susan Shaw, Petra Peters, Valerie White and Tania Lieven. He died on December 22, 1971 in London, England.
biography.name: Albert Lieven

biography.placeOfBirth: Stettin, Pomerania, Germany [now Szczecin, Zachodniopomorskie, Poland]
biography.bio: Ellen Schwiers was born on June 11, 1930 in Stettin, Pomerania, Germany. She is an actress, known for 1900 (1976), 3096 Jours (2013) and Le Dernier Témoin (1960). She was previously married to Peter Jacob.
biography.name: Ellen Schwiers

biography.birthName: Carl Sebastian Martin Wery de Lemans
biography.bio: Carl Wery was born on August 7, 1894 in Trostberg, Germany as Carl Sebastian Martin Wery de Lemans. He was an actor, known for Twenty Brave Men (1960), Das Tor zum Paradies (1949) and Sebastian Kneipp (1958). He was married to Erna Fentsch. He died on March 14, 1975 in Munich, Bavaria, West Germany.
biography.name: Carl Wery

biography.bio: Peer Schmidt was born on March 11, 1926 in Erfurt, Germany. He was an actor, known for Le petit docteur (1974), Von Mäusen und Menschen (1968) and Frühling in Baden-Baden (1967). He was married to Helga Schlack. He died on May 8, 2010 in Berlin, Germany.
biography.name: Peer Schmidt

biography.bio: Oliver Grimm was born on April 3, 1948 in Munich, Germany. He is an actor, known for Mon ami le clown (1955), Little Man on Top (1957) and Frühlingslied (1954).
biography.name: Oliver Grimm

biography.bio: Hermann Thimig was born on October 3, 1890 in Vienna, Austria-Hungary as Hermann Friedrich August Thimig. He was an actor, known for The Doll (1919), The 3 Penny Opera (1931) and Viktor and Viktoria (1933). He was married to Vilma Degischer and Hanna Wisser. He died on July 7, 1982 in Vienna, Austria.
biography.name: Hermann Thimig

biography.bio: Margitta Scherr was born on August 15, 1943 in Chemnitz, Germany. She is an actress, known for Boni (1966), Salto mortale (1969) and Our Man in Jamaica (1965). She was previously married to Karl-Heinz Vogelmann.
biography.name: Margitta Scherr

biography.bio: Helga Schlack was born on October 12, 1938 in Berlin, Germany. She is an actress, known for And Saucy at That (1960), Theorie und Praxis (1962) and Das kleine Wunder (1961). She was previously married to Peer Schmidt.
biography.name: Helga Schlack

biography.bio: Harald Maresch was born on June 10, 1916 in Vienna, Austria-Hungary. He was an actor, known for Body in the Web (1960), Many Passed By (1956) and Das veilchenblaue Auto (1961). He died on December 7, 1986 in Los Angeles, California, USA.
biography.name: Harald Maresch

biography.bio: Willi Rose was born on February 4, 1902 in Berlin, Germany as Wilhelm Bernhard Max Rose. He was an actor, known for Bei Pfeiffers ist Ball (1966), The Beaver Coat (1962) and 100 Jahre Kurfürstendamm (1966). He was married to Inge Rose. He died on June 16, 1978 in West Berlin, West Germany.
biography.name: Willi Rose

biography.bio: Gerd Frickhöffer was born on November 21, 1913 in Tianjin as Gerhard Emil Karl Josef Frickhöffer. He was an actor, known for Percy Stuart (1969), Sergeant Berry (1974) and The Oil Prince (1965). He was married to Irene Korb. He died on July 5, 1980 in Baden-Baden, Baden-Württemberg, West Germany.
biography.name: Gerd Frickhöffer

biography.bio: Oskar Paulig is an actor, known for Als ich noch der Waldbauernbub war... (1963), The Phony American (1961) and Madame Irène Besser (1961).
biography.name: Oskar Paulig

biography.bio: Siegfried Schürenberg was born on January 12, 1900 in Detmold, Germany as Siegfried Hermann Andreas Wittig. He was an actor, known for The Bridge (1959), Le château des chiens hurlants (1968) and The Devil Came from Akasava (1971). He was married to Charlotte and Margareta Christina. He died on August 31, 1993 in Berlin, Germany.
biography.name: Siegfried Schürenberg
